title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson, 35, and Dayana Slade, 25, were arrested in Lewiston, Maine for the murder of Mike Jonas, 40.
Thompson was charged with first-degree murder; Slade with accessory after the fact, both pleaded not guilty in Brockton District Court.
Jonas was found with gunshot and stab wounds in Finnegan Park; Thompson and Slade evaded police from September to February.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox attempted multiple times to trade for Angels shortstop Zach Neto during the offseason.
Zach Neto, a standout shortstop, has recorded back-to-back 20-20 seasons and is under control until 2029.
Despite Neto's appeal, the Red Sox opted for Caleb Durbin from the Brewers, strengthening their infield for 2026.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, former Brockton driving school owner, sentenced to one day in jail for RMV bribery scheme.
Cardosa paid $20,000 in bribes for 100-300 applicants over 18 months to avoid road tests.
Prosecutors cited Cardosa's health issues from a 2022 assault as reason for reduced sentence.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B reportedly ended their relationship after unfollowing each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl LX.
They have a baby boy, born in November 2025, who is Cardi B's fourth child and Diggs' third.
Diggs faces felony strangulation charges with an arraignment scheduled for February 13, which was delayed for NFL postseason.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Bad Bunny's all-Spanish performance at Super Bowl LX Halftime Show, calling it outstanding.
Cora, proud of his Puerto Rican heritage, appreciated the cultural elements Bad Bunny incorporated into the performance.
Bad Bunny faced criticism from Donald Trump but received support from NFL commissioner Roger Goodell for his unifying show.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of body cam footage from the police response to the Brown University mass shooting.
The December shooting by Claudio Manuel Neves Valente at Brown killed two students and injured nine others.
Footage includes redactions to protect victims' privacy; police investigation into the incident is closed.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Keion White, San Francisco 49ers lineman, was shot in the ankle in San Francisco after the Super Bowl.
The shooting occurred after a verbal altercation between two groups; no arrests have been made.
White, who joined the 49ers from the Patriots, underwent surgery and is recovering with non-life-threatening injuries.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum, recovering from a ruptured Achilles, was assigned to the Maine Celtics to participate in practices.
Despite his May 2025 injury, Tatum has progressed ahead of schedule, participating in 5-on-5 scrimmages with coaches.
Tatum is contemplating his return, ensuring he fits with the Celtics team, currently tied for second in the East.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Vermont State Police rescued two Canadian hikers from Camel’s Hump mountain near Duxbury amid sub-zero temperatures.
The two hikers faced life-threatening conditions, with wind chills near minus 20 degrees and deep snow reported on the 4,083-foot mountain.
Rescue teams reached the hikers at 11:20 p.m.; the woman required a stretcher and was hospitalized for hypothermia.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots aim to address offensive line issues after Drake Maye was sacked six times in Super Bowl LX.
Team seeks to enhance offensive weapons for QB Maye, potentially targeting WRs like A.J. Brown or Alec Pierce.
New England plans to leverage their draft picks to build depth in key areas like offensive tackle and pass rush.
